The FOMC’s new Summary of Economic Projections showed a near-unanimous belief
from committee members that policy is not yet sufficiently restrictive. Projections for
the fed funds rate’s peak were revised upward from 5.1% in March to 5.6%. This implies
two more 0.25-percentage point rate hikes. Just two members believe the current range
of the fed funds rate is sufficient while 16 expect another rate hike is needed and 12 of
those expect 0.5 percentage point or more.
